title: How to get permission to use copyrighted music in my videos as background music - Quora

response.answer_text: One really easy way to do this is to make use of YouTube’s music library. YouTube There is a ton of free music there. You can additionally check the policies of other music to see if you can use it - much of the music on YouTube can be used in your video, but will then be monetized by the rights owner: YouTube Unfortunately, for use outside of YouTube, you will need to do clearance with the individual rights holder for use of their music - it is not as simple a process as some other types of music licensing: How To Acquire Music For Films -Mark

The Audio Library in You Tube is absolutely terrible, but if you want sound affects, well by all means go ahead. No matter what kind of music you are looking for in the ‘audio library’, every song is instrumental and there is practically no range or change in the music itself (monotonous). In the past, when I was searching for music in there, I could not find a descent one. For me, I kept hoping to find ‘good songs’ with singers performing, but to my great disappointment… none. This would make a great difference to the music in the Audio Library by having singers and/or groups in the music pieces. If you don’t want to lose your subscribers by using boring pieces of ‘strictly’ instrumental songs repeating the same range over and over in the song, then don’t bother going in there.
